name: Patolli (itch)
description:
Patolli was played by the Aztecs at the time of the Spanish arrival in Mexico. It was a gambling games, and is recorded as having been played by nobles for high stakes such as precious stones and gold beads. Montezuma would watch the nobles play at his court.

Rules

1.       Roll the dices.

2.       Select your piece.

3.       Select the tile to move.

4.       Complete a round of the board to end with a piece.

5.       Need to throw an exact number to exit the board.

6.       If throwed an one, a new piece can be set in game.

7.       Landing on an edge of the board make you play again.

8.       Cannot choose occupied houses.

9.       If cannot play any piece the turn ends.

10.   Landing on a house with a triangle makes you pay.

11.   Ending with a piece makes the opponent pay.

12.   The game ends when all the pieces of one side ends or one get no coins.
